author: mrabino1
content: quick question.. is there any plan that post-merge where the notion of finality is applied would allow for the eth2 staking contract deposit to be "seen" and applied to the beaconchain in a more predictable and timely manner?   this is brought up only as the primary reason for the 2048 block etc.. was to put sufficent delay that a re-org wouldnt impact things.. with finality, this is somewhat redudant.. (in my eyes).. that said, curious what the community's view is on the above.. thx..

author: .vbuterin
content: Yeah, it's absolutely an intended part of the post-merge cleanup fork to get rid of the eth1data voting mechanism and make depositing more streamlined

author: mrabino1
content: thank you.

author: mrabino1
content: unrelated to the above.. RE 1559 implemetation post-merge, to my understanding, each validator will then be responsible for setting his / her own gas limit for each block that is proposed.  Today, the miners (decently organized)  should put the limit at 30MM for the London hardfork.. to my understanding this is a manual setting overriding the default gas limit.. from my lens, that is fine. as there are fewer participants. however when viewed post-merge and we have a large group of folks that may or may not update the gas limit.. there may be wisdom in updating the default gas limit for the execution cleints to 30MM before the merge.. the concern is that the gas limit will be all over the place.
